analyzed: bskyur ba'i me tog dngul chu'i skyes bu'i mgo la 'bab par 'gyur ro //
translated: The flower cast will fall on the head of the quicksilver man.

original: de mthong nas gal te dngos grub chung du 'dod na de'i tshe sgrub pa pos me tog gi phreng ba bzung nas rdzing bu'i 'gram du 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de mthong nas gal te dngos grub chung du 'dod na de'i tshe sgrub pa pos me tog gi phreng ba bzung nas rdzing bu'i 'gram du 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Having seen that, if one desires minor powers, then at that time the practitioner should take the garland of flowers and enter the bank of the lake.

original: der phyin nas gzhu 'dom brgya phyin pas ka ba bzhis nye bar brgyan pa'i bsil khang mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: der phyin nas gzhu 'dom brgya phyin pas ka ba bzhis nye bar brgyan pa'i bsil khang mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Having gone there, having gone a distance of one hundred bow-lengths, one will see a pavilion adorned with four pillars.

original: de'i dbus na lo bcu drug lon pa'i rnam pa'i dngul chu'i skyes bu gnas te dgod bzhin du 'dri bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i dbus na lo bcu drug lon pa'i rnam pa'i dngul chu'i skyes bu gnas te dgod bzhin du 'dri bar 'gyur te /
translated: In the middle of that, a mercury being in the form of a sixteen-year-old abides, laughing and asking:

original: kye skyes bu brtson @103b 'grus dang ldan pa gang nas 'ongs /
analyzed: kye skyes bu brtson @103b 'grus dang ldan pa gang nas 'ongs /
translated: “Hey, man, where are you coming from?

original: ci 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: ci 'dzin par byed /
translated: What do you hold?

original: mig sman dang / mchil lham dang / rkang bol byug pa dang / ri lu dang ral gri la sogs pa'i sna tshogs pa'i dngos grub gang dag 'dzin par byed /
analyzed: mig sman dang / mchil lham dang / rkang bol byug pa dang / ri lu dang ral gri la sogs pa'i sna tshogs pa'i dngos grub gang dag 'dzin par byed /
translated: What do you hold, the various powers such as eye medicine, magic boots, foot ointment, pills, sword, and so on?

original: gal te bzung bar byas pa de'i tshe phra mo'i dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ba 'di la the tshom med do //
analyzed: gal te bzung bar byas pa de'i tshe phra mo'i dngos grub 'grub par 'gyur ba 'di la the tshom med do //
translated: If you hold them, then you will certainly attain the subtle powers.

original: gal te mi 'dod pa de'i tshe brgal te g-yon nas bskor te 'gro ba na /
analyzed: gal te mi 'dod pa de'i tshe brgal te g-yon nas bskor te 'gro ba na /
translated: If you do not want them, then go around to the left and pass by.

original: kin tu'i shing la sogs pa'i nags mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: kin tu'i shing la sogs pa'i nags mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: You will see a forest of kintū trees and so on.

original: nyi ma lnga'i bar du de'i 'bras bu rnams bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma lnga'i bar du de'i 'bras bu rnams bza' bar bya'o //
translated: For five days you should eat their fruit.

original: 'bras bu bzung nas 'gro bar bya ste de rnams la g-yon du bskor nas 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu bzung nas 'gro bar bya ste de rnams la g-yon du bskor nas 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: Having taken the fruit, you should go around to the left and pass by.

original: de dag 'das nas nyi ma gsum na lo bcu drug lon pa'i rnam pa mi'i gtso mo zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i bud med lha'i gzugs can rnams ra skyong zhing ngas te sgrub pa pos de'i drung du phyin nas reg pa dang rtse bar yang bya'o
analyzed: de dag 'das nas nyi ma gsum na lo bcu drug lon pa'i rnam pa mi'i gtso mo zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i bud med lha'i gzugs can rnams ra skyong zhing ngas te sgrub pa pos de'i drung du phyin nas reg pa dang rtse bar yang bya'o
translated: After they have passed, in three days, the sixteen-year-old woman, the chief of women, who is a vidyādhari, a celestial woman, will be tending the goats. The practitioner should approach her and touch and play with her.

original: // sgrub pa po'i skyes bus bltas pas des skrag pa chen po skyed par byed de bgegs rtsom par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: // sgrub pa po'i skyes bus bltas pas des skrag pa chen po skyed par byed de bgegs rtsom par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: When the practitioner looks at her, she will cause him to generate great fear and will also create obstacles.

original: mi'i gtso mo la bltas nas sgrub pa po'i skyes bu brtson 'grus chen po spa 'gong ba'i sems dang yid la mngon par 'dod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi'i gtso mo la bltas nas sgrub pa po'i skyes bu brtson 'grus chen po spa 'gong ba'i sems dang yid la mngon par 'dod par mi bya'o //
translated: When the chief of women is looked at, the practitioner should not let his mind and thoughts be overcome by great diligence and desire.

original: yud tsam 'dug nas kyang dga' bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: yud tsam 'dug nas kyang dga' bar 'gyur te /
translated: After a moment, she will become pleased,

original: ra rnams yongs su bsdus nas 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ra rnams yongs su bsdus nas 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and having gathered the goats, she will leave.

original: de'i phyi bzhin du rjes su 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyi bzhin du rjes su 'jug par bya'o //
translated: One should follow after her.

original: nyi ma drug rnams kyis 'bras s'a lu'i dri zhim po'i zhing rnams mthong bar 'gyur te de la snye ma lnga bzung nas 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma drug rnams kyis 'bras s'a lu'i dri zhim po'i zhing rnams mthong bar 'gyur te de la snye ma lnga bzung nas 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: For six days they will see fields of fragrant rice. They should take five handfuls of rice and move on.

original: nyi ma gsum phyin pa na gser ldan zhes bya ba'i padma'i mtsho mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyi ma gsum phyin pa na gser ldan zhes bya ba'i padma'i mtsho mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After three days they will see a lotus lake called Kanakavatī.

original: mtsho de las khrus bya zhing chu btung bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtsho de las khrus bya zhing chu btung bar bya'o //
translated: They should bathe in that lake and drink its water.

original: padma'i rtsa ba bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: padma'i rtsa ba bza' bar bya'o //
translated: They should eat the lotus roots.

original: zos nas kyang rtsa ba la sogs pa mang po gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: zos nas kyang rtsa ba la sogs pa mang po gzung bar bya'o //
translated: After eating, they should take many roots and so forth.

original: bzung nas yang 'gro bar bya zhing song ba na shing skya snar gyi nags mthong bar 'gyur te de la g-yon nas bskor te 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzung nas yang 'gro bar bya zhing song ba na shing skya snar gyi nags mthong bar 'gyur te de la g-yon nas bskor te 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: After taking them, they should move on. When they go, they will see a forest of white birch trees. They should go around it on the left side.

original: de la shin tu 'das nas ga pur shing rnams mthong bar 'gyur te blang bar byas nas ji ltar bde bar bza' bar bya'o /
analyzed: de la shin tu 'das nas ga pur shing rnams mthong bar 'gyur te blang bar byas nas ji ltar bde bar bza' bar bya'o /
translated: After passing it, they will see camphor trees. They should take them and eat them as much as they like.

original: gzung bar bya ste ji ltar nus pa bkyer bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ste ji ltar nus pa bkyer bar bya'o //
translated: They should take them and distribute them as much as they can.

original: de 'das nas nyi ma gcig na shing aa shva ttha'i nags mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de 'das nas nyi ma gcig na shing aa shva ttha'i nags mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: After passing that, in one day he will see the forest of the aśoka trees.

original: de la g-yon skor gyis phyin pa na rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi skyed mos tshal dang lha ma yin gyi skyed mos tshal sna tshogs pa'i shing la sogs pa ba ku la dang aa mra la sogs pa'i 'bras bu @104a * //
analyzed: de la g-yon skor gyis phyin pa na rig pa 'dzin pa la sogs pa rnams kyi skyed mos tshal dang lha ma yin gyi skyed mos tshal sna tshogs pa'i shing la sogs pa ba ku la dang aa mra la sogs pa'i 'bras bu @104a * //
translated: Circumambulating it to the left, he will see the garden of the knowledge-holders and so forth, and the various gardens of the demigods, with trees and so forth, and the fruits of the bakula, mango, and so forth.

original: rnams dang / me tog dz'a ti dang / kunda dang / ma li ka dang / tsam pa ka dang / n'a ga ge ser la sogs pa'i me tog yang dag pas khyab par mthong bar 'gyur te de la cung zad kyang blang bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: rnams dang / me tog dz'a ti dang / kunda dang / ma li ka dang / tsam pa ka dang / n'a ga ge ser la sogs pa'i me tog yang dag pas khyab par mthong bar 'gyur te de la cung zad kyang blang bar mi bya'o //
translated: He will see the garden filled with jasmine, jasmine, mallika, champak, ironwood, and so forth. He should not take anything from there.

original: de las 'das nas chu'i rgyun dri ma med pa mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de las 'das nas chu'i rgyun dri ma med pa mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: After passing that, he will see a stream of pure water.

original: de la g-yon nas bskor nas 'gro ba ni nyi ma gsum na dri ma med par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i rdzing bu mthong bar 'gyur te rdzing bu de la khrus bya'o //
analyzed: de la g-yon nas bskor nas 'gro ba ni nyi ma gsum na dri ma med par ldan pa zhes bya ba'i rdzing bu mthong bar 'gyur te rdzing bu de la khrus bya'o //
translated: Circumambulating it to the left, in three days he will see a lake called Endowed with Purity. He should bathe in that lake.

original: rtsa ba rnams bza' bar bya zhing nyi ma gsum bsdad nas 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba rnams bza' bar bya zhing nyi ma gsum bsdad nas 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: One should eat the roots and stay there for three days.

original: nyi ma gsum na 'dod pa'i rgyal mo zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal mo nu ma phyed g-yogs pa khang pa dang ldan pa go la za bzhin du gnas pa de mthong bar 'gyur te de'i drung du 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma gsum na 'dod pa'i rgyal mo zhes bya ba'i rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal mo nu ma phyed g-yogs pa khang pa dang ldan pa go la za bzhin du gnas pa de mthong bar 'gyur te de'i drung du 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: After three days one will see the queen of knowledge-bearers named “Queen of Desire,” who is half-covered by her breasts, who lives in a house, and who eats earth. One should go to her.

original: rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal mo zhes bya ba'i bud med des dris pa gang du 'gro bar 'gyur bar byed /
analyzed: rig pa 'dzin pa'i rgyal mo zhes bya ba'i bud med des dris pa gang du 'gro bar 'gyur bar byed /
translated: The woman named “Queen of Knowledge-Bearers” will ask, “Where will you go?”

original: sgrub pa pos kyang lan smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa pos kyang lan smra bar bya ste /
translated: The adept should reply,

original: dpal ldan po ta la ka'i bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bzhugs sar 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: dpal ldan po ta la ka'i bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug bzhugs sar 'gro bar byed do //
translated: “I will go to the place where the glorious Lord Avalokiteśvara resides.”

original: de thos nas smras pa /
analyzed: de thos nas smras pa /
translated: Having heard that, she will say,

original: bdag gi khyim du zo la 'gro bar byos zhes so //
analyzed: bdag gi khyim du zo la 'gro bar byos zhes so //
translated: “Eat in my house and then go.”

original: de nas yang de rang gi skyed mos tshal gyi dbus na zangs dang dngul dang gser gyis rab tu bskor ba'i ra ba can rin po che du mas nye bar brgyan pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa khang pa yang sna tshogs pa'i rin po che bkod pa'i ka bas
analyzed: de nas yang de rang gi skyed mos tshal gyi dbus na zangs dang dngul dang gser gyis rab tu bskor ba'i ra ba can rin po che du mas nye bar brgyan pa'i khang pa brtsegs pa khang pa yang sna tshogs pa'i rin po che bkod pa'i ka bas
translated: pillars inside that are also made of various jewels.

original: nye bar brgyan par 'gro bar 'gyur te rang gi khyim du phyin na 'khor bos te smras pa /
analyzed: nye bar brgyan par 'gro bar 'gyur te rang gi khyim du phyin na 'khor bos te smras pa /
translated: When he arrives at his house, his wives say to him,

original: myur du tshos shig bsgo bas de skad smras ma thag tu bud med kyis yongs su bskor ba'i bud med de rnams kyis tshos pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa khyer nas 'ongs te /
analyzed: myur du tshos shig bsgo bas de skad smras ma thag tu bud med kyis yongs su bskor ba'i bud med de rnams kyis tshos pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa khyer nas 'ongs te /
translated: “Cook quickly!” As soon as they say this, the women who surround him bring various cooked foods.

original: bud med rnams rim pa ji lta bar sna tshogs pa'i rin po che'i rang bzhin gyis spras pa'i stan rnams bting ste /
analyzed: bud med rnams rim pa ji lta bar sna tshogs pa'i rin po che'i rang bzhin gyis spras pa'i stan rnams bting ste /
translated: The women sit on seats that are covered with various jewels in order of rank.

original: stan rnams la rim pa ji lta bar zas bza'o //
analyzed: stan rnams la rim pa ji lta bar zas bza'o //
translated: They eat the food in order of rank.

original: kha bshal ba byas nas ga bur dang bcas pa'i go la ster ro //
analyzed: kha bshal ba byas nas ga bur dang bcas pa'i go la ster ro //
translated: After they rinse their mouths, they are given betel nut with camphor.

original: byin nas yang smras pa /
analyzed: byin nas yang smras pa /
translated: Having given it, she will say,

original: cung zhig bzhes shig / phyi nas rang nyid kyis 'bras bu dang rtsa ba mang po gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: cung zhig bzhes shig / phyi nas rang nyid kyis 'bras bu dang rtsa ba mang po gzung bar bya ste /
translated: “Eat a little, and later you can take many fruits and roots yourself.

original: bdag gis bzhag na 'di nyid du sdod par byed dam /
analyzed: bdag gis bzhag na 'di nyid du sdod par byed dam /
translated: If I leave it here, will you stay here?

original: gal te khyod nyid tshangs par spyod pa yin na de'i tshe slar byang gi sgo nas go la snoms la bzhud par byos shig /'di la yid kyis mngon par 'dod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te khyod nyid tshangs par spyod pa yin na de'i tshe slar byang gi sgo nas go la snoms la bzhud par byos shig /'di la yid kyis mngon par 'dod par mi bya'o //
translated: If you are a celibate, then you should go back out the northern gate and take the path. Do not desire this place with your mind.”

original: der gal te sgrub po zhen pa med pa ngo tsha dang bcas pa'i tshangs par spyod pa 'gro bar @104b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der gal te sgrub po zhen pa med pa ngo tsha dang bcas pa'i tshangs par spyod pa 'gro bar @104b 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, if the adept is free of attachment, and is modest, he will leave.

original: de'i tshe bud med des 'gro ba'i dus su byang gi sgor gzhug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bud med des 'gro ba'i dus su byang gi sgor gzhug par 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, the woman will open the northern gate for him to leave.

original: byang gi sgor zhugs nas smras pa /
analyzed: byang gi sgor zhugs nas smras pa /
translated: Having entered the northern gate, she will say,

original: de nas bse shing 'bras bu'i nags mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nas bse shing 'bras bu'i nags mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: “Go to the north, and you will see a forest of fruit-bearing kṣīrikā trees.

original: myur ba myur bar bse shing gi 'bras bu'i dbus su sngags zlos shing 'gro bar bya'o //
analyzed: myur ba myur bar bse shing gi 'bras bu'i dbus su sngags zlos shing 'gro bar bya'o //
translated: Quickly, quickly, recite the mantra while going to the middle of the kṣīrikā fruit trees.

original: de la sngags ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la sngags ni 'di yin te /
translated: The mantra is as follows:

original: aom dh'i dh'i dh'i:h'a aom h'um kham aa pa b'ad aa pa b'ad /
analyzed: aom dh'i dh'i dh'i:h'a aom h'um kham aa pa b'ad aa pa b'ad /
translated: Om dhi dhi dhi ha om hum kham apavaḍa apavaḍa.

original: der phyin nas nyi ma bzhi nas dga' ba'i tshal tshan chen po mthong bar 'gyur te slar yang shar phyogs nas zhugs nas bltas pas /
analyzed: der phyin nas nyi ma bzhi nas dga' ba'i tshal tshan chen po mthong bar 'gyur te slar yang shar phyogs nas zhugs nas bltas pas /
translated: Having gone there, after four days one will see the great Nandana forest.

original: shing s'a la dang / shing ta la dang / pi y'a la dang / aa mra dang / 'bras bu tsher ma can dang / chu shing gi 'bras bu dang / bil ba dang / na rangga dang / ka pi ttha dang / dzam bi ra la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams dang /
analyzed: shing s'a la dang / shing ta la dang / pi y'a la dang / aa mra dang / 'bras bu tsher ma can dang / chu shing gi 'bras bu dang / bil ba dang / na rangga dang / ka pi ttha dang / dzam bi ra la sogs pa'i 'bras bu rnams dang /
translated: Having entered from the east and looked, one will see trees such as the sāla, the tāla, the piyāla, the mango, the thorny fruit, the banana, the bilva, the naranagara, the kapittha, the jambīra, and so forth, and their fruits.

original: me tog manand'a ra ba chen po dang / shing yongs 'du dang / tsam pa ka dang / mya ngan med dang / klu shing dang / ba ku la la sogs pa dang / dz'a ti dang / kunda dang / se pha li ka dang /
analyzed: me tog manand'a ra ba chen po dang / shing yongs 'du dang / tsam pa ka dang / mya ngan med dang / klu shing dang / ba ku la la sogs pa dang / dz'a ti dang / kunda dang / se pha li ka dang /
translated: There are also flowers such as the great mandārava, the pārijāta, the campaka, the aśoka, the nāga, the bakula, and so forth, and the jasmine, the jasmine of the gods, the jasmine of the forest, and the jasmine of the snow.

original: aa m'a l'a dang / ha sa ra kendu la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i me tog rnams dang / rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rdzing bu rnams ni padma dang autpa la la sogs pa'i me tog mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: aa m'a l'a dang / ha sa ra kendu la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i me tog rnams dang / rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rdzing bu rnams ni padma dang autpa la la sogs pa'i me tog mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and various flowers such as jasmine, hasurakendu, and so forth, and various ponds with flowers such as lotuses and utpalas.

original: sna tshogs pa'i 'bras bu bza' bar bya ba rnams slar yang nags kyi dbus su zhugs te 'bras bu sna tshogs bza' bar bya'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i 'bras bu bza' bar bya ba rnams slar yang nags kyi dbus su zhugs te 'bras bu sna tshogs bza' bar bya'o //
translated: Having eaten various fruits, again enter the forest and eat various fruits.

original: de las 'das nas lha ma yin gyi gnas gzhi chen po mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las 'das nas lha ma yin gyi gnas gzhi chen po mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Having passed beyond that, one will see the great abode of the asuras.

original: gnas gzhi der 'jug par bya ste de la g-yon nas bskor nas 'gro ba na /
analyzed: gnas gzhi der 'jug par bya ste de la g-yon nas bskor nas 'gro ba na /
translated: Enter that abode and circumambulate it to the left.

original: s'a la'i shing chen po yod do //
analyzed: s'a la'i shing chen po yod do //
translated: There is a great sāla tree.

original: de la yang g-yon nas bskor nas 'gro ba dang // nyi ma gsum tshangs pa'i gnas bdun brtsegs pa mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la yang g-yon nas bskor nas 'gro ba dang // nyi ma gsum tshangs pa'i gnas bdun brtsegs pa mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Having circumambulated that to the left, one will see three suns and the seven stacked abodes of Brahmā.

original: sna tshogs pa'i 'bras bu mang po rnams bzung nas 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs pa'i 'bras bu mang po rnams bzung nas 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Having taken many various fruits, enter.

original: khang pa dang po na rje btsun seng ge sgra bzhugs par mthong bar 'gyur te de mthong nas lus sa la phab pa'i phyag bya'o //
analyzed: khang pa dang po na rje btsun seng ge sgra bzhugs par mthong bar 'gyur te de mthong nas lus sa la phab pa'i phyag bya'o //
translated: In the first house one will see the Venerable Siṃhanāda. Having seen him, one should pay homage by prostrating with one’s body to the ground.

original: sgo nas zhugs pa na rje btsun dpal nag po chen po 'jigs pa chen po mdzad pa bong stod che ba de mthong nas 'jigs par mi bya'o ;
analyzed: sgo nas zhugs pa na rje btsun dpal nag po chen po 'jigs pa chen po mdzad pa bong stod che ba de mthong nas 'jigs par mi bya'o ;
translated: When one enters through the door, one will see the Venerable Śrī Mahākāla performing great terrifying deeds, with a large hump on his back. Having seen him, one should not be afraid.

original: / g-yas nas bskor nas phrar khang so sor 'jug par bya ste /
analyzed: / g-yas nas bskor nas phrar khang so sor 'jug par bya ste /
translated: Circumambulating to the right, one should enter the small house.

original: rje btsun phyag bya bar 'os pa la mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: rje btsun phyag bya bar 'os pa la mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: One should make offerings, service, and so forth to the Venerable One who is worthy of homage.

original: mi mthong bar mi 'gyur te rgod pa'i tshig thos par 'gyur bas de la 'jigs par mi bya ste /
analyzed: mi mthong bar mi 'gyur te rgod pa'i tshig thos par 'gyur bas de la 'jigs par mi bya ste /
translated: One will not fail to see him, but one will hear the sound of laughter. One should not be afraid of that.

original: gal te bdun brtsegs kyi gnas thams cad kyi bar @105a * //
analyzed: gal te bdun brtsegs kyi gnas thams cad kyi bar @105a * //
translated: If one enters all the way up to the seventh story,

original: du 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: du 'jug par bya'o //
translated: one should enter there.

original: de'i tshe thams cad kyi steng na rje btsun sangs rgyas mthong bar 'gyur ta mchog tu dad pas lus sa la phab pa'i phyag bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe thams cad kyi steng na rje btsun sangs rgyas mthong bar 'gyur ta mchog tu dad pas lus sa la phab pa'i phyag bya'o //
translated: At that time, one will see the Venerable Buddha above all, and one should pay homage by prostrating with one’s body to the ground with supreme faith.

original: phyag byas nas gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bklag par bya ste /
analyzed: phyag byas nas gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba'i tshigs su bcad pa bklag par bya ste /

translated: He will see all the buddhas and all the bodhisattvas, and the world of Sukhāvatī.

original: de bzhin du bdag nyid kyis bya zhing nga dang 'dra ba'i byang chub sems dpa' bar byos shig / yi ge drug pa'i rig sngags chen mo nga'i kha la mnyan par gyis shig / de nas thos pa tsam gyis phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nga
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag nyid kyis bya zhing nga dang 'dra ba'i byang chub sems dpa' bar byos shig / yi ge drug pa'i rig sngags chen mo nga'i kha la mnyan par gyis shig / de nas thos pa tsam gyis phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub sems dpa' nga
translated: In the same way, he should do it himself and become like me, a bodhisattva. He should listen to the six-syllable great knowledge mantra from my mouth. Then, merely by hearing it, he will become a bodhisattva like me, irreversible.

original: dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes dpal ldan po ta la ka'i rje btsun gyi zhal snga nas gsungs pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: dang 'dra bar 'gyur ro zhes dpal ldan po ta la ka'i rje btsun gyi zhal snga nas gsungs pa rdzogs so /
translated: This is what the glorious Potawa Jetsun said. It is complete.

original: // / pho brang skyid kyi byang mkhar du lha bla ma zhi ba'i blo gros kyi lung gis /
analyzed: // / pho brang skyid kyi byang mkhar du lha bla ma zhi ba'i blo gros kyi lung gis /
translated: By the order of the divine master Shiwaï Lodrö,

original: rgya gar shar phyogs kyi pandi ta aa bhi yukta de ba shr'i dang / bod kyi lo ts'a ba bande dha rma yon tan gyis ji ltar rnyed par bsgyur ba'o //

translated: the Indian pandit Abhayakara Gupta and the Tibetan translator Bande Dharma Yönten translated this text as it was found.

original: 'di ni gzhu min ri dags ma yin phag gi phrug gu min //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhu min ri dags ma yin phag gi phrug gu min //
translated: This is not a bow, not a deer, not a piglet,

analyzed: yongs su rdzogs pa'i zla ba'i gdong can mdzes ma ma yin te //

analyzed: ri khrod lhag pa'i rgyal po ri bo dpe yi mchog la yang dag bzhugs//
